name: Sejun Song
content: Sejun SongSearch this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationSejun Song, Ph.D.Cynthia Tang Endowed Professor,Missouri University of Science and Technology (MST)Email: songsej@mst.edusjsong @ gmail.comLinkedin Short BiographySejun Song, Ph.D. is a Cynthia Tang Endowed Professor of Computer Science at the Missouri University of Science and Technology (MST). Dr. Song conducts Cybersecurity, Machine Learning, Internet-of-Things, and Mobile and Wireless Communications research projects for transportation, smart agriculture, smart cities, and eHealth applications. Song received his Ph.D. in Computer Science and Engineering from the University of Minnesota, Twin Cities, in 2001. He worked for Augusta University (AU), University of Missouri – Kansas City (UMKC), and Texas A&M University, College Station (TAMU), as a professor and a founding director of the Cisco Test Engineering Center (Cisco-TEC). Before joining academia, Song worked in industries including Cisco Systems and Honeywell Research Lab. He is a recipient of the Center for Teaching Excellence Scholar for excellence in undergraduate teaching, a Faculty Teaching Excellence Award, a NASA Summer Fellowship Award, Air Force Research Lab's Visiting Faculty Research Fellowship Awards, a Cisco Summer Fellowship Award, and several best research video/paper awards including CCNC 2019, ISC2 2018, Mobisys 2014, ICCCN 2014, and CIEC 2013. Several agencies have funded his research, including NSF, AFOSR, Cisco Systems, ETRI, NIST, AFRL, NASA, NIH, CDC, TAMU, KT Research, and MoDoT.Experience Google SitesReport abuseGoogle SitesReport abuse
